page.title: 03PRECINCT TRADERS, RHYL
page.content: Of the 24 shops open, 12 are part of a national chain, 6 are members of a large group and 6 are privately owned. 11 had premises in Rhyl previously and, of these, 9 have closed their other shop and say trade is better in the precinct. All the traders said weather affected business in that more people came into the precinct in bad weather. Only one trader was disappointed with trade and two said it was only fair. The main advantage of having a shop in the precinct was the security aspect. Some traders said the precinct was locked too early and they wanted easier access out of opening hours. Deliveries at the back entrance in Church Street could be difficult when cars parked across the gates or traders had to leave a busy shop to carry packages a considerable distance
